Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Usage_Duration_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Usage_Duration_Distribution.description:
For the distribution of each contraceptive, a randomly selected duration from this distribution will determine when the woman stops using the contraceptive.  This is independent of how long the contraceptive is effective. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Usage_Duration_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Usage_Duration_Max** and **Usage_Duration_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Usage_Duration_Gaussian_Mean** and **Usage_Duration_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Usage_Duration_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Usage_Duration_Kappa** and **Usage_Duration_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Usage_Duration_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Usage_Duration_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Usage_Duration_Poisson_Mean**. 
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Usage_Duration_Proportion_0** and **Usage_Duration_Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Usage_Duration_Mean_1**, **Usage_Duration_Mean_2**, and **Usage_Duration_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Usage_Duration_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Usage_Duration_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Usage_Duration_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Usage_Duration_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Usage_Duration_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Usage_Duration_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Usage_Duration_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Usage_Duration_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Usage_Duration_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Usage_Duration_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Usage_Duration_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Usage_Duration_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Usage_Duration_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Usage_Duration_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Usage_Duration_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Usage_Expiration_Event.description: When the woman stops using the contraceptive, this event will be broadcasted. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible built-in values, or create custom values using **Custom_Individual_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Waning_Config.description: A WaningEffect object used to control the efficacy of the contraceptive, typically over time. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Configs.description: An array of interventions that will be distributed as specified in the calendar. This parameter selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class.

Calendar.description: An array of JSON objects where each object specifies the age and probability of receiving the interventions.  The parameters of the Calendar objects are Age and Probability.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs that will prevent an intervention from being distributed or applied/updated (persistent interventions will abort/expire in the time step they see the change in their individual property). See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the person will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Dropout.description: If set to true (1), when an intervention distribution is missed, all subsequent interventions are also missed. If set to false (0), all calendar dates/doses are applied independently of each other.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' per intervention distributed. For interventions distributed to people, the cost will be added for each person. For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Setting **Cost_To_Consumer** to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from diagnosis (which is done when the intervention is distributed) until a positive response is performed. The response to a negative diagnosis is done immediately when the diagnosis is made (at distribution of the intervention).

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs that will prevent an intervention from being distributed or applied/updated (persistent interventions will abort/expire in the time step they see the change in their individual property). See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the person will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Enable_Is_Symptomatic.description: If true (1), requires an infection to be symptomatic to return a positive test.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: If **Event_Or_Config** is set to **Event**, this parameter defines the event to be broadcasted on a negative test result. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values or define custom events by adding to the list for the configuration parameter **Custom_Individual_Event**.

Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if **Event_Or_Config** is set to **Event**. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values.

Positive_Threshold_Acquisition_Immunity.description: Specifies the threshold for acquired immunity, where 1 equals 100% immunity and 0 equals 100% susceptible.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated or given the **Positive_Diagnosis_Config** or **Positive_Diagnosis_Event** when used in campaign classes that trigger separate interventions or events upon a positive diagnosis.

Boost_Mortality.description: Specifies the boosting effect on mortality immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine. This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Threshold_Acquire.description: Specifies how much acquisition immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Threshold_Mortality.description: Specifies how much mortality immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Threshold_Transmit.description: Specifies how much transmission immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a prime to a boost.

Boost_Transmit.description: Specifies the boosting effect on transmission immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity) for a multi-effect booster vaccine. This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the person will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Duration_To_Modifier.description: An array of Times and Values used to specify different modifiers over the duration of the intervention. Linear interpolation is used to find the values between time points. If the duration exceeds the max time, then the last modifier value will be used.

Expiration_Duration_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Expiration_Duration_Distribution.description:
For the distribution of each intervention, a randomly selected duration from this distribution will determine when the person stops using the intervention. This is independent of how long the intervention is effective. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Expiration_Duration_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Expiration_Duration_Max** and **Expiration_Duration_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Expiration_Duration_Gaussian_Mean** and **Expiration_Duration_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Expiration_Duration_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Expiration_Duration_Kappa** and **Expiration_Duration_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Expiration_Duration_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Expiration_Duration_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Expiration_Duration_Poisson_Mean**. 
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Expiration_Duration_Proportion_0** and **Expiration_Duration_Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Expiration_Duration_Mean_1**, **Expiration_Duration_Mean_2**, and **Expiration_Duration_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Expiration_Duration_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Expiration_Duration_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Expiration_Duration_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Expiration_Duration_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Expiration_Event.description: When the person stops using the intervention, this event will be broadcasted. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values or define custom events using config parameter **Custom_Individual_Events**.

Duration_At_Node_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for assigning the duration of time an individual or family spends at a destination node after intervention-based migration. Each assigned value is a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Duration_At_Node_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Duration_At_Node_Max** and **Duration_At_Node_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Duration_At_Node_Gaussian_Mean** and **Duration_At_Node_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Duration_At_Node_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Duration_At_Node_Kappa** and **Duration_At_Node_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Duration_At_Node_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Duration_At_Node_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Duration_At_Node_Poisson_Mean**.
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Duration_At_Node_Proportion_0** and **Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Duration_At_Node_Mean_1**, **Duration_At_Node_Mean_2**, and **Duration_At_Node_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Kappa** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Lambda**.

* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Poisson_Mean**. 
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Proportion_0** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Mean_1**, **Duration_Before_Leaving_Mean_2**, and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Antigen.description: The antigenic base strain ID of the outbreak infection.

Genome.description: The genetic substrain ID of the outbreak infection. Together with **Antigen**, they are a unitary object representing a strain of infection, which allows for differentiation among infections.

Ignore_Immunity.description: Individuals will be force-infected (with a specific strain) regardless of actual immunity level when set to true (1).

Incubation_Period_Override.description: The incubation period, in days, that infected individuals will go through before becoming infectious. This value overrides the incubation period set in the configuration file. Note for HIV simulations only: If set to 0, infection is assumed to be part of an outbreak event and a random duration until death is determined. For all other simulation types: Set to -1 to honor the configuration parameter settings.

Daily_Probability.description: The daily probability that an individual's property value changes to the **Target_Property_Value**.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs that will prevent an intervention from being distributed or applied/updated (persistent interventions will abort/expire in the time step they see the change in their individual property). For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Maximum_Duration.description: The maximum amount of time individuals have to move to a new group. This timing works in conjunction with **Daily_Probability**.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Revert.description: The number of days to keep the value (**Target_Property_Value**) of the property (**Target_Property_Key**) set by the intervenion for the individual. When the time has expired, the intervention will reset the property back to the value it had when the intervention was first applied.

Target_Property_Key.description: The name of the individual property type whose value will be updated by the intervention.

Target_Property_Value.description: The user-defined value of the individual property that will be assigned to the individual.

Boost_Effect.description: Specifies the boosting effect on [acquisition/transmission/mortality] immunity for previously exposed individuals (either natural or vaccine-derived). This does not replace current immunity, it builds multiplicatively on top of it.

Boost_Threshold.description: Specifies how much immunity is required before the vaccine changes from a priming effect to a boosting effect.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' per intervention distributed. For interventions distributed to people, the cost will be added for each person. For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Setting **Cost_To_Consumer** to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Efficacy_Is_Multiplicative.description: The overall vaccine efficacy when individuals receive more than one vaccine. When set to true (1), the vaccine efficacies are multiplied together; when set to false (0), the efficacies are additive.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Prime_Effect.description: Specifies the priming effect on [acquisition/transmission/mortality] immunity for naive individuals (without natural or vaccine-derived immunity).

Vaccine_Take.description: The rate at which delivered vaccines will successfully stimulate an immune response and achieve the desired efficacy. For example, if it is set to 0.9, there will be a 90 percent chance that the vaccine will start with the specified efficacy, and a 10 percent chance that it will have no efficacy at all.

Vaccine_Type.description:
The type of vaccine to distribute in a vaccine intervention. Possible values are:
* Generic - The vaccine can reduce transmission, acquisition, and mortality.
* TransmissionBlocking - The vaccine will reduce pathogen transmission.
* AcquisitionBlocking - The vaccine will reduce the acquisition of the pathogen by reducing the force of infection experienced by the vaccinated individual.
* MortalityBlocking - The vaccine reduces the disease-mortality rate of a vaccinated individual.

Waning_Config.description: The configuration of the vaccine's efficacy and waning over time. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

Base_Sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals with the condition being tested receive a positive diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Base_Specificity.description: The specificity of the diagnostic. This sets the proportion of the time that individuals without the condition being tested receive a negative diagnostic test. When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the lack of having the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who do not have the condition always receive a false-positive diagnostic test.

Cost_To_Consumer.description: The unit 'cost' per intervention distributed. For interventions distributed to people, the cost will be added for each person. For internventions distributed to nodes, the cost is for each node. Setting **Cost_To_Consumer** to zero for all other interventions, and to a non-zero amount for one intervention, provides a convenient way to track the number of times the intervention has been applied in a simulation.

Days_To_Diagnosis.description: The number of days from diagnosis (which is done when the intervention is distributed) until a positive response is performed. The response to a negative diagnosis is done immediately when the diagnosis is made (at distribution of the intervention).

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs that will prevent an intervention from being distributed or applied/updated (persistent interventions will abort/expire in the time step they see the change in their individual property). See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access. For example, to prevent the same individual from accessing health care via two different routes at the same time.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If an individual's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the person will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Enable_Is_Symptomatic.description: If true (1), requires an infection to be symptomatic to return a positive test.

Event_Or_Config.description: Specifies whether the current intervention distributes a nested intervention (the Config option) or an event will be broadcast which may trigger other interventions in the campaign file (the Event option). Possible values are: **Event**, **Config**

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **IndividualProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to indicate the broad category of health care cascade to which an intervention belongs to prevent individuals from accessing care through multiple pathways. For example, if an individual must already be taking a particular medication to be prescribed a new one.

Positive_Diagnosis_Config.description: The intervention distributed to individuals if they test positive. Only used when **Event_Or_Config** is set to Config.See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values.

Positive_Diagnosis_Event.description: If the test is positive, this specifies an event that can trigger another intervention when the event occurs. Only used if **Event_Or_Config** is set to **Event**. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values.

Treatment_Fraction.description: The fraction of positive diagnoses that are treated or given the **Positive_Diagnosis_Config** or **Positive_Diagnosis_Event** when used in campaign classes that trigger separate interventions or events upon a positive diagnosis.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Config.description: The configuration of an actual intervention sought. Selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class. Only used if **Event_Or_Config** is set to 'Config'.

Actual_IndividualIntervention_Event.description: The event of an actual intervention sought. Selects a class for the intervention and configures the parameters specific for that intervention class. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values. Used only if **Event_Or_Config** is set to 'Event'.

Efficacy_Is_Multiplicative.description: The overall vaccine efficacy when individuals receive more than one vaccine. When set to true (1), the vaccine efficacies are multiplied together; when set to false (0), the efficacies are additive.

Vaccine_Take.description: The rate at which delivered vaccines will successfully stimulate an immune response and achieve the desired efficacy. For example, if it is set to 0.9, there will be a 90 percent chance that the vaccine will start with the specified efficacy, and a 10 percent chance that it will have no efficacy at all.

Vaccine_Type.description:
The type of vaccine to distribute in a vaccine intervention. Possible values are:
* Generic - The vaccine can reduce transmission, acquisition, and mortality.
* TransmissionBlocking - The vaccine will reduce pathogen transmission.
* AcquisitionBlocking - The vaccine will reduce the acquisition of the pathogen by reducing the force of infection experienced by the vaccinated individual.
* MortalityBlocking - The vaccine reduces the disease-mortality rate of a vaccinated individual.

Waning_Config.description: The configuration of the vaccine's efficacy and waning over time. Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

When set to 1, the diagnostic always accurately reflects the condition. When set to zero, then individuals who have the condition always receive a false-negative diagnostic test.

Negative_Diagnosis_Event.description: If **Event_Or_Config** is set to **Event**, this parameter defines the event to be broadcasted on a negative test result. See :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible values or define custom events by adding to the list for the configuration parameter **Custom_Individual_Event**.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If a node's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the node will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Duration.description: The number of days to continue this intervention. It will listen and respond to events during this time. A value of -1 (the default) keeps the intervention running indefinitely.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **NodeProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Broadcast_Event.description: The Coordinator Event to be broadcasted by this node.  An Event Coordinator like **TriggeredEventCoordinator** could be activated from this event. Custom events may be defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Antigen.description: The antigenic base strain ID of the outbreak infection.

Daily_Import_Pressures.description: The rate of per-day importation for each node that the intervention is distributed to.

Durations.description: The durations over which to apply import pressure.

Genome.description: The genetic substrain ID of the outbreak infection. Together with **Antigen**, they are a unitary object representing a strain of infection, which allows for differentiation among infections.

Import_Age.description: The age (in days) of infected import cases.

Duration_At_Node_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Duration_At_Node_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for assigning the duration of time an individual or family spends at a destination node after intervention-based migration. Each assigned value is a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Duration_At_Node_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Duration_At_Node_Max** and **Duration_At_Node_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Duration_At_Node_Gaussian_Mean** and **Duration_At_Node_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Duration_At_Node_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Duration_At_Node_Kappa** and **Duration_At_Node_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Duration_At_Node_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Duration_At_Node_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Duration_At_Node_Poisson_Mean**.
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Duration_At_Node_Proportion_0** and **Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Duration_At_Node_Mean_1**, **Duration_At_Node_Mean_2**, and **Duration_At_Node_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

Duration_At_Node_Exponential.description: The mean for an exponential distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Gaussian_Mean.description: The mean for a Gaussian distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Gaussian_Std_Dev.description: The standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Kappa.description: The shape value in a Weibull distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Lambda.description: The scale value in a Weibull distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Log_Normal_Mu.description: The mean for a log-normal distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Log_Normal_Sigma.description: The width for a log-normal distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Max.description: The maximum of the uniform distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Mean_1.description: The mean of the first exponential distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Mean_2.description: The mean of the second exponential distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Min.description: The minimum of the uniform distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Peak_2_Value.description: The value to assign to the remaining individuals/instances.

Duration_At_Node_Poisson_Mean.description: The mean for a Poisson distribution.

Duration_At_Node_Proportion_0.description: The proportion of individuals/instances to assign a value of zero.

Duration_At_Node_Proportion_1.description: The proportion of individuals/instances in the first exponential distribution.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Constant.description: Each instance will receive this constant/fixed value.

Duration_Before_Leaving_Distribution.description:
The distribution type to use for assigning the duration of time a family waits before migrating to the destination node after all residents are home. Each assigned value is a random draw from the distribution. Possible values are:
* NOT_INITIALIZED - No distribution set.
* CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use the same value for each individual. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Constant**.
* UNIFORM_DISTRIBUTION - Use a uniform distribution with a given minimum and maximum. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Max** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Min**.
* GAUSSIAN_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is Gaussian (or normal). Values are resampled to ensure >= 0. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Gaussian_Mean** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Gaussian_Std_Dev**.
* EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - The distribution is exponential with a given mean. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Exponential**.
* WEIBULL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Weibull distribution with a given shape and scale. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Kappa** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Lambda**.
* LOG_NORMAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use a log-normal distribution with a given mean and standard deviation of the natural log. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Log_Normal_Mu** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Log_Normal_Sigma**.
* POISSON_DISTRIBUTION - Use a Poisson distribution with a given mean. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Poisson_Mean**. 
* DUAL_CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION - Use a distribution where some individuals are set to a value of zero and the rest to a given value. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Proportion_0** and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Peak_2_Value**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for CONSTANT_DISTRIBUTION.
* DUAL_EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION - Use two exponential distributions with given means. Set **Duration_Before_Leaving_Mean_1**, **Duration_Before_Leaving_Mean_2**, and **Duration_Before_Leaving_Proportion_1**. This distribution does not use the parameters set for EXPONENTIAL_DISTRIBUTION.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **NodeProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **IndividualProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that individuals must have to be targeted by this intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. To specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs, use **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**. You cannot use both of these parameters in the same event coordinator.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Target_Age_Max.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be less than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Target_Demographic.description:
The target demographic group. Possible values are:
* Everyone
* ExplicitAgeRanges
* ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender
* ExplicitGender
* ExplicitDiseaseState

Target_Gender.description:
Specifies the gender restriction for the intervention. Possible values are:
* Male
* Female
* All

Target_Residents_Only.description: When set to true (1), only individuals that currently reside in their 'home' node will be selected.  The 'home' node is either the one they began the simulation in or the one set by the **MigrateIndividuals** or **MigrateFamily** interventions.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of individual events that will trigger the distribution of the intervention. The events contained in the list can be built-in events (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events) or the custom events defined in **Custom_Individual_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Daily_Probability.description: The daily probability that the node's property value changes to the **Target_NP_Key_Value**.

Disqualifying_Properties.description: A list of **NodeProperty** key:value pairs that will prevent an intervention from being distributed or applied/updated (persistent interventions will abort/expire in the time step they see the change in their node property). See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. Generally used to control the flow of health care access.

Dont_Allow_Duplicates.description: If a node's container has an intervention with the same name (**Intervention_Name**) as this intervention and this parameter is set to true (1), then the node will not from receive another copy of the intervention. Supported by all intervention classes.

Intervention_Name.description: The optional name used to refer to this intervention as a means to differentiate it from others that use the same class.

Maximum_Duration.description: The maximum amount of time in days nodes have to update the property value. This timing works in conjunction with **Daily_Probability**.

New_Property_Value.description: An optional **NodeProperty** key:value pair that will be assigned when the intervention is first applied/updated. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information.

Revert.description: The number of days to keep the value of the property/key, specified in **Target_NP_Key_Value** and set by the intervenion, for the node. When the time has expired, the intervention will reset the property/key back to the value it had when the intervention was first applied.

Target_NP_Key_Value.description: The **NodeProperty** key:value pair, as defined in the demographics file, to assign to the node.

Antigen.description: The antigenic base strain ID of the outbreak infection.

Genome.description: The genetic substrain ID of the outbreak infection. Together with **Antigen**, they are a unitary object representing a strain of infection, which allows for differentiation among infections.

Import_Age.description: The age (in days) of infected import cases.

Number_Cases_Per_Node.description:
The number of new imported individuals.
.. note:: This will increase the population with demographics of 50/50 male/female and user-defined ages

Probability_Of_Infection.description: The probability that new individuals are infected. 1.0 implies all new individuals are infected while 0.0 adds all of the people as susceptible individuals.

Node_List.description: A comma-separated list of node IDs in which this event will occur.

Event_To_Broadcast.description: The action event to occur when the specified trigger value in the **Threshold** parameter is met. At least one action must be defined for **Event_To_Broadcast**. The events contained in the list can be built-in events (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events).

Event_Type.description: The type of event to be broadcast.  Possible values are: COORDINATOR, INDIVIDUAL, or NODE

Threshold.description: The COUNT or PERCENTAGE, as configured with **Threshold_Type**, threshold value that must be met before the action from **Action_List** will be considered.  The sampled value must be greater than or equal to this value and less than the action whose threshold is greater in order for the action to be selected.  Once selected, it will broadcast the **Event_To_Broadcast** event.

IP_Key_Value.description: An **IndividualProperties** Key:Value pair where the key/property name and one of its values is separated by a colon (':').

Is_Equal_To.description: This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.

Intervention_Name.description: The name of the intervention the person should have.  This cannot be an empty string but should be either the name of the class or the name given to the intervention of interest using the parameter Intervention_Name.  EMOD does not verify that this name exists.

Is_Equal_To.description: This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.
This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.
This is used to determine if the individual is selected based on the result of the value of the question. Set to 1 for true and 0 for false.

Logic.description: This is a two-dimensional array of JSON objects.  The elements of the inner array will be AND'd together while the arrays themselves will be OR'd.  This is similar to **Property_Restrictions_Within_Node**.  This array and the inner arrays cannot be empty.

idmType:AdditionalRestrictionsMatrix.description: Two dimensional array of configuration objects of type idmAbstractType:AdditionalRestrictions.

Age.description: As a parameter of a Calendar object, this parameter determines the age (in days) that the individual must be in order to receive the list of actual interventions.

Probability.description: As a parameter of a Calendar object, this parameter determines the probability of an individual receiving the list of actual interventions at the corresponding age.

Max.description: This parameter determines the maximum age, in years for individuals to be included in the targeted population. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

Min.description: This parameter determines the minimum age, in years for individuals to be included in the targeted population. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Event_Trigger_List.description: The list of individual events to included in the report.  There will be a channel in the report for each event.

Filename_Suffix.description: Augments the filename of the report. If multiple reports are being generated, this allows you to distinguish among the multiple reports.

Max_Age_Years.description: Maximum age in years of people to collect data on

Min_Age_Years.description: Minimum age in years of people to collect data on

Must_Have_IP_Key_Value.description: A Key:Value pair that the individual must have in order to be included. Empty string means to not include IPs in the selection criteria.

Must_Have_Intervention.description: The name of the intervention that the person must have in order to be included. Empty string means to not include interventions in the selection criteria.

Node_IDs_Of_Interest.description: Data will be collected for the nodes in this list.  Empty list implies all nodes.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

Age_Bins.description: The age bins (in years, in ascending order) to aggregate within and report. An empty array does not stratify by age.

IP_Key_To_Collect.description: The name of the **IndividualProperties** (IP) key by which to stratify the report. An empty string means the report is not stratified by IP.

Stratify_By_Gender.description: Set to true (1) to stratify by gender. Set to false (0) to not stratify by gender.

Age_At_Infection_Histogram_Report_Age_Bi.description: A list of ages in years where an individual will count in the upper value bin when their age is between two bins.

Age_At_Infection_Histogram_Report_Report.description: This is the amount of time data is collected and then written to the file.  This value has units in years.

End_Day.description: The day of the simulation to stop collecting data.

Include_Health_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the Health table which has data for each time step for the health of an individual.

Include_Individual_Properties.description: Include a table with all the possible IPs and include the IP data for each person in the Health table.

Include_Infection_Data_Table.description: A true value (1) includes the InfectionData table which has data for each time step for each active infection.

Start_Day.description: The day of the simulation to start collecting data.

Count_Events_For_Num_Timesteps.description: If set to true (1), then the waning effect values, as specified in the Effect_List list of objects for the WaningEffectCombo classes, are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value cannot be greater than 1.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

Node_Property_Restrictions.description: A list of the **NodeProperty** key:value pairs, as defined in the demographics file, that the node in which the individual is currently located must have in order to be targeted for the intervention. See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Target_Age_Min.description: The age, in years, of an indivdividual being considered must be greater than or equal to this value in order to be selected. Used when **Target_Demographic** is set to ExplicitAgeRanges or ExplicitAgeRangesAndGender.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: A list of individual events that when broadcasted by an individual will be counted by the **Incidence_Counter** if the individual is in the targeted group. The events contained in the list can be built-in events (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events) or the custom events defined in **Custom_Individual_Events** in the simulation configuration file.

Count_Events_For_Num_Timesteps.description: If set to true (1), then the waning effect values, as specified in the Effect_List list of objects for the WaningEffectCombo classes, are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value cannot be greater than 1.

Counter_Event_Type.description:
Type of events that can be included in **Trigger_Condition_List**. Possible values are:
* COORDINATOR
* INDIVIDUAL
* NODE

Counter_Period.description: When **Counter_Type** is set to PERIODIC, this is the counter period (in days).

Counter_Type.description: Counter type used for surveillance of events. The counter is triggered by events in **Start_Trigger_Condition_List** and the counter stops when it receives an event in **Stop_Trigger_Condition_List** or the listening duration expires. The only current allowed value is PERIODIC - Once triggered, events are counted during the period (in days) as set in **Counter_Period**. At the end of the period, the counter will notify **Responder** with the data accumulated and then start listening again, continuing forever until it is stopped or the duration expires. For example, if the listening duration is 45 days, **Counter_Period** is 30, and the counter is triggered on day 20, it will never complete the counter period and trigger the responder.

Demographic_Coverage.description: The fraction of individuals in the target demographic that will receive this intervention.

See :ref:`demo-properties` parameters for more information. You can specify AND and OR combinations of key:value pairs with this parameter.

Targeting_Config.description: Be more selective of individuals by using the :doc:`parameter-campaign-targeting-config`.

Trigger_Condition_List.description: The list of events that when broadcasted will be counted by the **Incidence_Counter**. The list cannot be empty. The type of events contained in the list is determined by the **Counter_Event_Type** parameter. Depending upon the type, the events must be built-in (see :doc:`parameter-campaign-event-list` for possible events) or defined in one of the following configuration parameters: **Custom_Coordinator_Events**, **Custom_Individual_Events**, or **Custom_Node_Events**.

Times.description: An array of days or years, depending on how it is used.  The **Times** and **Values** must be of equal length, and can consist of a single value. **Times** must monotonically increase.

Values.description: An array of values to match the defined Times.  The meaning of the value depends on how it is being used.  It could be coverage fraction, intervention efficacy, or even a probability.  It must have the same number of elements as its associated parameter **Times**

Coverage.description: The percentage of people in the node that should be randomly selected to receive the intervention.  The value must be a float between 0 and 1.

Node_Id.description: The ID of the node specified in the demographics to which this coverage applies.

Coordinator_Event_To_Broadcast.description: The coordinator event to broadcast when the node is selected (i.e. is the first one found with the NP key:value).

Node_ID.description: The ID of the node found in the demographics to check if it has the given node property.

idmType:NodePropertyRestrictions.description: List of objects containing key:value pairs of properties. Intersection of key:value pairs within object; union across objects in list.

idmType:PropertyRestrictions.description: List of objects containing key:value pairs of properties. Intersection of key:value pairs within object; union across objects in list.

Action_List.description: An array specifying a list of possible actions (JSON objects with parameters **Threshold**, **Event_Type**, **Event_To_Broadcast**) to take if a particular threshold is met. An action is taken when the specified threshold value is less than the number of incidents counted. If there are multiple actions listed, then the action with the highest threshold value, that is also less than the number of incidents counted, is selected. The list cannot be empty.

Threshold_Type.description:
The threshold type indicates how **Responder** handles the counting of events from **Incidence_Counter** and the thresholds in **Action_List**. Possible values are:
* COUNT - A raw count of events. Also, with COUNT, setting the **x_Base_Population** configuration parameter can affect the number count by changing the population but it could be very indirect.
* PERCENTAGE - Counts the number of individuals that meet the restrictions and then to divide the total number of events by this number. Note that it is possible for an individual to emit an event that might not be counted in the denominator if their demographic restriction attributes changed between the time of the emitted event and the time the denominator was counted.
PERCENTAGE_EVENTS (supported in **SurveillanceEventCoordinator** only) - **Percentage_Events_To_Count** lists the events that will be counted for the denominator, which will then be used with the specified event for **Trigger_Condition_List** to be counted for the numerator.

Action_List.description: An array specifying a list of possible actions (JSON objects with parameters **Threshold**, **Event_Type**, **Event_To_Broadcast**) to take if a particular threshold is met. An action is taken when the specified threshold value is less than the number of incidents counted. If there are multiple actions listed, then the action with the highest threshold value, that is also less than the number of incidents counted, is selected. The list cannot be empty.

Percentage_Events_To_Count.description: When **Threshold_Type** equals PERCENTAGE_EVENTS then **Percentage_Events_To_Count** lists the events that will be counted for the denominator which will then be used with the specified event for **Trigger_Condition_List** counted for the numerator.

Responded_Event.description: A coordinator event, defined in **Custom_Coordinator_Events**, that is broadcast if **Responder** responded. More specifically, at the completion of a counting period, if an action is selected, the action events are broadcast and then the **Responded_Event** is also broadcast.  This allows other event coordinators to react to the action events being broadcast.

Threshold_Type.description:
The threshold type indicates how **Responder** handles the counting of events from **Incidence_Counter** and the thresholds in **Action_List**. Possible values are:
* COUNT - A raw count of events. Also, with COUNT, setting the **x_Base_Population** configuration parameter can affect the number count by changing the population but it could be very indirect.
* PERCENTAGE - Counts the number of individuals that meet the restrictions and then to divide the total number of events by this number. Note that it is possible for an individual to emit an event that might not be counted in the denominator if their demographic restriction attributes changed between the time of the emitted event and the time the denominator was counted.
PERCENTAGE_EVENTS (supported in **SurveillanceEventCoordinator** only) - **Percentage_Events_To_Count** lists the events that will be counted for the denominator, which will then be used with the specified event for **Trigger_Condition_List** to be counted for the numerator.

Age_Ranges_Years.description: A list of age ranges that individuals must be in to qualify for an intervention. Each age range is a JSON object with a minimum and a maximum property. An individual is considered in range if their age is greater than or equal to the minimum age and less than the maximum age, in floating point years of age. It must have the same number of objects as **Num_Targeted_XXX** has elements.

End_Day.description: The day to stop distributing the intervention. No interventions are distributed on this day or going forward. Defines the time period to distribute the intervention along with **Start_Day**. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

Num_Targeted.description: The number of individuals to target with the intervention. Note that this value will be scaled up by the population scaling factor equal to **x_Base_Population**. If using this parameter, **Num_Targeted_Males** and **Num_Targeted_Females** must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Females.description: The number of female individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using this parameter with **Num_Targeted_Males** to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and **Num_Targeted** must be empty.

Num_Targeted_Males.description: The number of male individuals to distribute interventions to during this time period. If using this parameter with **Num_Targeted_Females** to target specific genders, they both must be the same length, and **Num_Targeted** must be empty.

Property_Restrictions_Within_Node.description: A list of JSON objects where each object has Individual Property (IP) Keys as JSON keys and IP Values as JSON values (like 'Risk' : 'HIGH').  The values in the object are AND'd together while the objects are OR'd together.  An individual's IP values must meet the logic in order to receive the intervention. You may specify individual property restrictions using either this parameter or **Property_Restrictions**, but not both.

Start_Day.description: The day to start distributing the intervention. Defines the time period to distribute the intervention along with **End_Day**. The intervention is evenly distributed between each time step in the time period.

Box_Duration.description: The box duration of the effect in days.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Box_Duration.description: The box duration of the effect in days.

Decay_Time_Constant.description: The exponential decay length, in days.  The current effect is initialized with **Initial_Effect** and it is updated each time step as 'current_effect *= (1 - dt/**Decay_Time_Constant**)' (dt equal to delta time).

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Add_Effects.description: The **Add_Effects** parameter allows you to combine multiple effects from the waning effect classes. If set to true (1), then the waning effect values from the different waning effect objects are added together. If set to false (0), the waning effect values are multiplied. The resulting waning effect value must be greater than 1.

Effect_List.description: A list of nested JSON parameters to indicate how the intervention efficacy wanes over time.

Expires_When_All_Expire.description: If set to true (1), then all of the effects, as specified in the **Effect_List** parameter, must expire for the efficacy of the intervention to expire. If set to false (0), then the efficacy of the intervention will expire as soon as one of the parameters expires.

Initial_Effect.description: The initial efficacy of the effect.  The efficacy of the effect will changes from this value depending on the effect.  For one of the WaningEffectBoxXXX's, this will be the value during the efficacy of the effect during the **Box_Duration**.  For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Decay_Time_Constant.description: The exponential decay length, in days.  The current effect is initialized with **Initial_Effect** and it is updated each time step as 'current_effect *= (1 - dt/**Decay_Time_Constant**)' (dt equal to delta time).

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

For one of the WaningEffectMapXXX's, the value acts as a multiplier used to define the magnitude of the shape of the curve defined in the effect.

Durability_Map.description: The time, in days, since the intervention was distributed and a multiplier for the **Initial_Effect**.

Expire_At_Durability_Map_End.description: Set to 1 to let the intervention expire when the end of the map is reached.

Expected_Discard_Time.description: The mean time, in days, of an exponential distribution of the duration of the effect of an intervention (such as a vaccine or bed net). Specify how this effect decays over time using one of the :doc:`parameter-campaign-waningeffects`.

idmType:WaningEffectCollection.description: List of configuration objects for parameterizing waning effects.

Use_Defaults.description: Set to true (1) if you don't want to have to specify all params for event coordinators and interventions. Use at own risk.
Set to true (1) if you don't want to have to specify all params for the reports.
